column5: Hey all -- on my trip to Temagami and some of the small back lakes next week (can't believe it's almost here!) I want to bring a couple of small lake/gang trolls with me....any suggestions on what to tip them with?  I suppose a minnow would be the obvious choice, but live bait may not be the most convenient up there.  A tube jig?  Fly? If anybody has a suggestion, I'd love to hear it
LOL -- well I will definitely have those with me....could be worth a shot
seriously, a minnow is my first choice. After that, any thing goes. I've even run them with worm harnesses off them for inland 'bows.  Sinker
well...I MIGHT bring the minnow trap...will probably have some worms....I'm thinking a tube jig fluttering along back there could do nicely.  maybe I could stuff the tube with some mallow??
I have good luck with berkley power nuggets stuffed in my tubes.....lol.  A Berkley power minnow or  similar will work just as well. Load up on plastics.  Sinker
I was thinkin' a jig and Gulp grub if live bait isn't an option.
What's wrong with a smaller "peanut" like they run for Lake O lakers?
A little foam thing that looks like a 1 1/2" J-Plug.  Y'know I don't even know what it's real name is, lol. All the trolling guys I talk to swear by the thing for lakers though.
Ohhhhh, I know the thing!  I've also seen little jobbys similar to that with wings on 'em...sort of a pimped out worm harness/ Thanks CLofchik.  I will add it to the shopping list for tomorrow
Gang trolls are supposed to imitate a school of minnows.

Peanuts and Cow Bells is what us Lake O guys use for Laker's ..i have had lots of guys coming in the store that are  going north to get Peanuts from me and have had great catches with them  ...also Spin & Glows work just as well about 18" behind the Gang Troll..

hey johnny well if u want minnows just find a beaver dam that is alive...green branches will tell u if it is a used beaver dam..then with a 4 inch by 4 inch minnow net and a piece of bread...you can catch all the minnows you need....nice size too.....im in temagami in 2 weeks cant wait...acually less than 2 weeks...were you staying in temagami johnny...im at temagami lodge and have been there for about 12 years..
A short piece of mono (say 30") with a fly and dew worm can have its moments for early season brookies or late season rainbows.  outdoorguy61
thanks for the feedback folks!  I've got a whole pile of stuff ready to trail behind those spoons....hopefully I'll get a chance to use some of it
hope you do well in temagami  johnny..
